{"step_by_step_thinking": "Synarthroses are a type of joint fixation where there is no movement between the bones. Suture refers to a type of synarthrosis found in the skull, while syndesmosis is another type of synarthrosis that connects two bones with fibrous connective tissue. Gomphosis refers to the type of synarthrosis found in tooth attachment. Based on this information, all three options are types of synarthroses.", "answer_choice": D}
